results.title: Joe Mcbain: blacksmith
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon, Nina Syme and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”.
Joe McBain started as an apprentice blacksmith, in 1916, at a general blacksmith shop. These shops were involved in woodwork, mending farm equipment and shoeing horses. In this film, Joe talks about old blacksmithing methods.

results.title: Nick Mount: glass blower
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon, Nina Syme and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”.
Nick Mount, a glass blower, discusses the skills necessary for his craft and the type of work he does himself. Shows him at work at his country property where he works three to four weeks at a time.

results.title: Stand by me (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Rob Reiner, Raynold Gideon, Bruce A. Evans, Andrew Scheinman, ACT III Communications and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1956, four youths set out on a two-day trek through the woods surrounding their home-town of Castle Rock, Oregon, to find the undiscovered body of a dead teenager reported missing for several days. Their adventure is filled with humour and suspense as they learn about friendship and growing up. Starring River Phoenix, Wil Wheaton, Corey Feldman, Kiefer Sutherland, John Cusack and Richard Dreyfuss.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rob Reiner, Raynold Gideon, Bruce A. Evans, Andrew Scheinman, ACT III Communications and Columbia Pictures

results.title: Victoria Howlett: potter
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon, Nina Syme and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”.
Victoria Howlett regards her pottery as a reflection of her personality, her travels and her various experiences. She finds inspiration for her work in nature and approaches her tasks very systematically.

results.title: Chris Sanders: potter
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”.
This is a film about potter, Chris Sanders, working under the direction of an experienced master potter. After having had his own workshop for five years, Chris realised that he needed to learn more about the craft, and this could be best done under the guidance of a master potter. Both Chris and his master discuss this experience.

results.title: Stage door canteen
results.creator_credit: Frank Borzage, Sol Lesser and Sol Lesser Productions
results.brief_description: At a Stage Door Canteen in Manhattan, three enlisted men on a one-day pass to New York meet and fall in love with three hostesses working there (Cheryl Walker, Marjorie Riordan, Dorothea Kent). This film is noted for its 60 plus celebrities who star as themselves, rather than the love story that provides the backdrop for their appearance. The setting allows for a cavalcade of musical and comedy numbers as well as cameo appearances. Cast also includes William Terry, Lon McCallister and Michael Harrison.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Borzage, Sol Lesser and Sol Lesser Productions

results.title: Stanley & Iris = Stanley and Iris
results.creator_credit: Martin Ritt, Alex Winitsky, Arlene Sellers, Lantana Productions and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A feel-good romantic drama with a social conscience, “Stanley & Iris” tackles the serious problem of illiteracy which affects one out of every five American adults. Recently widowed and working mother of two teenage children, Iris (Jane Fonda) is struggling, both financially and emotionally. Stanley (Robert DeNiro) lives alone with his elderly father and is unable to read or write, a problem he has lived with for his entire life. The two meet when Stanley comes to the aid of Iris after her handbag is stolen, soon discovering that they are co-workers from the same local commercial bakery. And so begins a friendship. However, it is not long before Iris becomes aware of Stanley’s problem and when he eventually loses his job because of his illiteracy, Stanley asks for Iris’s help in teaching him to read. The bond of friendship and support gradually draws Stanley and Iris together into an affair of the heart. Strong performances by DeNiro and Fonda provide depth and soul into what could have been a somewhat schmaltzy and overly sentimental film. Cast also includes Swoosie Kurtz, Martha Plimpton, Harley Cross, Jamey Sheridan, Feodor Chaliapin. Based on the novel “Union Street” by Pat Barker, screenplay by Harriet Frank, Jr and Irving Ravetch.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin Ritt, Alex Winitsky, Arlene Sellers, Lantana Productions and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer

results.creator_credit: Stine Baska, Peter Napier and Action Replay

results.title: St. Albans: an ethnic programme (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ian Hart and Canberra. College of Advanced Education. Media Centre
results.brief_description: St Albans is a multilingual, multicultural community where 85% of the population are migrants from non-English speaking countries. St Albans East primary school, with a schools commission grant, employ parents in a program to increase the children’s awareness of community languages and culture.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Hart and Canberra. College of Advanced Education. Media Centre
